items.text: RecyclerView is designed to be very efficient, even with large lists, by reusing, or recycling, the views that have scrolled off the screen.
items.href: Use RecyclerView to display a scrollable list

items.text: When a list item is scrolled off the screen, RecyclerView reuses that view for the next list item about to be displayed.
items.href: Use RecyclerView to display a scrollable list

items.text: The strings.xml file should look like this when you're done.
items.href: Use RecyclerView to display a scrollable list

items.text: Now that you have added string resources, you can reference them in your code as R.string.affirmation1 or R.string.affirmation2.
items.href: Use RecyclerView to display a scrollable list

items.text: Data displayed in your app may come from different sources (e.g. within your app project or from an external source that requires connecting to the internet to download data).
items.href: Use RecyclerView to display a scrollable list

items.text: The rest of the app should not concern itself with where the data originates from or in what format it is originally.
items.href: Use RecyclerView to display a scrollable list

items.text: You can and should hide away this data preparation in a separate Datasource class that prepares the data for the app.
items.href: Use RecyclerView to display a scrollable list
